summary: Skimmed milk, categorized under processed agricultural produce, plays a vital role in EU regulatory frameworks concerning dairy products. This product, which is defatted and diluted, serves as a base for various utilizations, including the production of casein and caseinates. The valorization of skimmed milk is essential for dairies, as it allows for the incorporation of this ingredient into compounded feeds and other dairy products. Unauthorized selling or mislabeling can lead to penal consequences, including penalties for non-compliance. Henceforward, regulations dictate the standards for packaging and quality, ensuring that products meet the required specifications to avoid jeopardized market positions.
